ygData.subject: Re: Confusing strategy tips in many "wizard guid es"
ygData.msgSnippet: In my groups right now..  I root something, and he hits it.  If he gets damaged too much, he backs away, and the creature is still stuck.  So I know for SURE
ygData.messageBody:
In my groups right now.. I root something, and he hits it. If he gets damaged too much, he backs away, and the creature is still stuck. So I know for SURE that root stays there.

> nope rooting is cancelled if someone attack with melee weapon (and HIT) i am
> nearly sure of that... Just try to root a rat, then pierce him one time then
> go back everytime you do it the root is cancelled... I was killed yesterday
> by the klik queen cause i root her too close from me and each time i was
> casting i was fighting at the same time and hit her (i root her sucessfully
> about 6 times and 6 times she continues to move to me). So for me root stop
> when someone attack the monster with a melee attack and Hit.
>
> I am going to try this this evening to let you know..

> > Not true. Rooting has a random length it seems. Sometimes the root wears

> > So rooting it works well, as long as it remains intact. Hitting the

> > > > >
> > > > > Well, no matter how hard you try it is impossible to avoid all hits!
> > > > > Otherwise a wizard could go around killing everything in Norrath
> > with
> > > ease.
> > > > > Ways to minimize the hits you do take though, are to travel in a
> > group
> > > with
> > > > > nice big tank in front of you. While you let him stand there and
> > take
> > > all
> > > > > the punishment you can relax, sit back, and nuke some monsters. If
> > you
> > > are
> > > > > alone, never forget to memorize root. It is a wizards best friend,
> > at
> > > least
> > > > > until higher lvls when you get better spells which essentially do
> > the
> > > same
> > > > > thing. When fighting alone here is my suggestion for a strategy..
> > root
> > > > > something, move back and then cast all your offensive spells at it.
> > If
> > > you
> > > > > kill it before running out mana you win and never get hit.. if you
> > run
> > > out
> > > > > of mana and it's still alive, you may win, but probably not. For a
> > > wizard
> > > > > it's all about being able to get your spells off to do the fantastic
> > dmg
> > > > > that we do, this becomes impossible if the creature is standing
> > right in
> > > > > front interrupting your spells each time you try and cast them.
> > Well, I
> > > > > hope helps you somewhat.
> > > > >
> > > > > Tandayen, Dark Elf Wizard

> > > > > >What confuses me, now after playing the game myself, are all the

> > > > > >
